trans-unit.source: A fast, secure and easy to use VPN. Built by the makers of Firefox.

trans-unit.note: Refers to the installed version; Example - "Release Version: 1.23"

trans-unit.source: VPN must be off before enabling
trans-unit.note: This is a Setting which requires the VPN to be disconnected to change state

trans-unit.source: VPN must be off before disabling
trans-unit.note: This is a Setting which requires the VPN to be disconnected to change state
The current IP address
The current download speed. The speed is shown on the next line.
The current upload speed. The speed is shown on the next line.
Example: You have "x of y" devices in your account, where y is the limit of allowed devices.

trans-unit.source: Turn on to protect your privacy

trans-unit.note: Refers to the state of the users current internet connection
Switches from location 1 to location 2

trans-unit.source: You’ve reached your limit. To install the VPN on this device, you’ll need to remove one.

trans-unit.note: Kilobits per Secound
Megabits per Second

trans-unit.source: Please confirm you would like to remove\n%1.
trans-unit.note: %1 is the name of the device being removed. "\n" is used to display it on a new line, please keep it in the translation.
"This is the 'remove' device button.
The title of the cities list.
Unstable Connection
Restore a service in case of an Error

trans-unit.source: Push the internet forward with the latest version of the Internet Protocol
Access printers, streaming sticks and all other devices on your local network

The back of the object, not the front

trans-unit.source: Waiting for sign in and subscription confirmation…
You can quickly access Mozilla VPN from your status bar.

trans-unit.source: Added less than an hour ago

trans-unit.source: We're Mozilla. We're on your side.
Protect your access to the web.
Please update the app before you continue to use the VPN
We detected and fixed a serious bug. You must update your app.
Your connection will not be secure while you update.

trans-unit.note: This refers to the current IP address, i.e. "IP: Unknown".
Location in the systray. %1 is the country, %2 is the city.
Shown as message body in a notification. %1 is the country, %2 is the city.
Shown as message body in a notification. %1 is the country, %2 is the city.
Shown as message body in a notification. %1 and %3 are countries, %2 and %4 are cities.
